body_content.explanation: technology that makes it possible to read text easily on an electronic device:
examples: E-paper contains millions of tiny capsules loaded with black and white particles of ink.
The touch-screen device uses "ePaper" technology to make it as much like reading normal newsprint as possible.
A new invention, "electronic paper", promises to remove the discomfort of reading books on a computer monitor.

body_content.explanation: a newspaper in electronic form that is read on a computer, etc.:
examples: This e-paper features a daily digest of home and international news, a soapbox section and arts reviews.
